variables.input:
fetch logs
| filter matchesPhrase(k8s.pod.name, "otelcol-collector")
| summarize count = count(), by: { k8s.pod.name }
| fields k8s.pod.name

39.title: Request count
39.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the incoming HTTP request count of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

42.content: ### Telemetry data passing through the collector

44.title: Span totals
44.description: This tile shows how many spans have been accepted/refused by the receivers, and how many have been sent/failed by the exporters of the selected OpenTelemetry Collector instance.
44.query:
// This query retrieves how many spans have been accepted/refused by the receivers, and how many have been sent/failed by the exporters of the selected OpenTelemetry Collector instance. 
timeseries { accepted=sum(otelcol_receiver_accepted_spans) },
  by: {receiver},
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }
  | fieldsAdd name="accepted", type="receiver", component=receiver, value=arraySum(accepted)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
| append [
  timeseries { refused=sum(otelcol_receiver_refused_spans) }, 
  by: {receiver},
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }  
  | fieldsAdd name="refused", type="receiver", component=receiver, value=arraySum(refused)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
] | append [
  timeseries { filtered=sum(otelcol_processor_filter_spans.filtered) },
  by: {filter},
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }    
  | fieldsAdd name="filtered", type="processor", component=filter, value=arraySum(filtered)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| append [
  timeseries {sent=sum(otelcol_exporter_sent_spans)}, 
  by: { exporter },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }  
  | fieldsAdd name="sent", type="exporter", component=exporter, value=arraySum(sent)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| append [
  timeseries {failed=sum(otelcol_exporter_send_failed_spans) }, 
  by: { exporter },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }  
  | fieldsAdd name="failed", type="exporter", component=exporter, value=arraySum(failed)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| fields name, type, component, value=toLong(value)

75.title: Span totals
75.description: This tile shows a timeseries of all spans that have passed through the selected OpenTelemetry Collector instance.

76.title: Metric datapoint totals
76.description: This tile shows a timeseries of all metric datapoints that have passed through the selected OpenTelemetry Collector instance.

77.title: Log totals
77.description: This tile shows a timeseries of all logs that have passed through the selected OpenTelemetry Collector instance.

79.title: Metric datapoint totals
79.description: This tile shows how many metric datapoints have been accepted/refused by the receivers, and how many have been sent/failed by the exporters of the selected OpenTelemetry Collector instance.
79.query:
// This query retrieves how many metric datapoints have been accepted/refused by the receivers, and how many have been sent/failed by the exporters of the selected OpenTelemetry Collector instance. 
timeseries { accepted=sum(otelcol_receiver_accepted_metric_points) }, 
  by: { receiver },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }
  | fieldsAdd name="accepted", type="receiver", component=receiver, value=arraySum(accepted)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
| append [
  timeseries { refused=sum(otelcol_receiver_refused_metric_points) }, 
  by: { receiver },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }
  | fieldsAdd name="refused", type="receiver", component=receiver, value=arraySum(refused)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| append [
  timeseries { filtered=sum(otelcol_processor_filter_datapoints.filtered) }, 
  by: {filter},
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }    
  | fieldsAdd name="filtered", type="processor", component=filter, value=arraySum(filtered)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| append [
  timeseries {sent=sum(otelcol_exporter_sent_metric_points)}, 
  by: { exporter },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }  
  | fieldsAdd name="sent", type="exporter", component=exporter, value=arraySum(sent)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| append [
  timeseries {failed=sum(otelcol_exporter_send_failed_metric_points) }, 
  by: { exporter },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }  
  | fieldsAdd name="failed", type="exporter", component=exporter, value=arraySum(failed)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| fields name, type, component, value=toLong(value)

80.title: Log record totals
80.description: This tile shows how many logs have been accepted/refused by the receivers, and how many have been sent/failed by the exporters of the selected OpenTelemetry Collector instance.
80.query:
// This query retrieves how many logs have been accepted/refused by the receivers, and how many have been sent/failed by the exporters of the selected OpenTelemetry Collector instance. 
timeseries { accepted=sum(otelcol_receiver_accepted_log_records) }, 
  by: { receiver },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }
  | fieldsAdd name="accepted", type="receiver", component=receiver, value=arraySum(accepted)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
| append [
  timeseries {refused=sum(otelcol_receiver_refused_log_records) },
  by: { receiver },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }
  | fieldsAdd name="refused", type="receiver", component=receiver, value=arraySum(refused)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| append [
  timeseries {filtered=sum(otelcol_processor_filter_logs.filtered)},
  by: {filter},
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }    
  | fieldsAdd name="filtered", type="processor", component=filter, value=arraySum(filtered)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| append [
  timeseries {sent=sum(otelcol_exporter_sent_log_records)}, 
  by: { exporter },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }  
  | fieldsAdd name="sent", type="exporter", component=exporter, value=arraySum(sent)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| append [
  timeseries {failed=sum(otelcol_exporter_send_failed_log_records) }, 
  by: { exporter },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) and k8s.pod.name==$K8sPodName }  
  | fieldsAdd name="failed", type="exporter", component=exporter, value=arraySum(failed)
  | fieldsKeep name, type, component, value
]
| fields name, type, component, value=toLong(value)

88.title: Request size
88.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the average incoming HTTP request size of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

89.title: Request duration
89.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the average incoming HTTP request duration of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

101.title: Total physical memory (resident set size)
101.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the memory consumption of the OpenTelemetry Collector.

102.title: Total CPU user and system time
102.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the CPU user and system time of the OpenTelemetry Collector.

106.title: Exporter current queue size
106.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the current exporter queue size of the OpenTelemetry Collector.

107.title: Exporter queue capacity
107.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the exporter queue capacity of the OpenTelemetry Collector.

108.content:
### Batch metrics
These are metrics reported by the [batchprocessor](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/blob/main/processor/batchprocessor/README.md), if used. They can be used to understand batching behavior.

109.title: Batch size (items)
109.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the batch size (in items) of the OpenTelemetry Collector.

118.title: Request count
118.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the outgoing HTTP request count of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

119.title: Request size
119.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the average outgoing HTTP request size of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

120.title: Request duration
120.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the average outgoing HTTP request duration of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

122.title: Request count
122.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the incoming RPC request count of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

123.title: Request size
123.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the average incoming RPC request size of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

124.title: Request duration
124.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the average incoming RPC request duration of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

126.title: Request count
126.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the outgoing RPC request count of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

127.title: Request duration
127.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the average outgoing RPC request duration of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

128.title: Request size
128.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the average outgoing RPC request size of  the OpenTelemetry Collector.

129.title: Batch size (bytes)
129.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the batch size (in bytes) of the OpenTelemetry Collector.

130.title: Batch processor send trigger
130.description: This tile shows a timeseries of the batch processor send triggers of the OpenTelemetry Collector.

132.content:
### OpenTelemetry Collector overview
This dashboard is designed to monitor the health and performance of a single OpenTelemetry Collector instance. [Find out how to set up this dashboard](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/otel-collector-self-monitoring).

133.content:
### Additional resources

Learn more about using the OpenTelemetry Collector with Dynatrace
* [Dynatrace OpenTelemetry Collector documentation](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/ingest-from/opentelemetry/collector)
* [OpenTelemetry Collector Dynatrace use cases](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/ingest-from/opentelemetry/collector/use-cases)
* [Dynatrace OpenTelemetry Collector Distribution](https://github.com/Dynatrace/dynatrace-otel-collector)
